title: Ticket #3150: condor_q -run should report hostname for local universe jobs
description:
It would be helpful if condor_q -run reported the name of the machine where a Local Universe job is running, e.g., 

[root@ldas-pcdev1 ~]# cat /etc/redhat-release
Scientific Linux release 6.1 (Carbon)

[root@ldas-pcdev1 ~]# uname -a
Linux ldas-pcdev1 2.6.32-220.13.1.el6.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Apr 17 15:16:22 CDT 2012 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

[root@ldas-pcdev1 ~]# condor_version
$CondorVersion: 7.8.1 Jun 08 2012 $
$CondorPlatform: x86_64_rhap_6.2 $

[root@ldas-pcdev1 ~]# condor_q -run shooper | tail -2
52355398.0   shooper         7/18 14:16   3+06:49:11 node269.cluster.ldas.cit
52355404.0   shooper         7/18 14:16   3+06:49:15 [????????????????]

But that last job is actually running, albeit in the Local Universe, 

[root@ldas-pcdev1 ~]# condor_q -long 52355404.0 | grep ^JobUniverse
JobUniverse = 12

[root@ldas-pcdev1 ~]# ps -ef | grep 52355404.0 | grep -v grep
condor   22513 21465  0 Jul18 ?        00:00:02 condor_starter -f -job-cluster 52355404 -job-proc 0 -header (52355404.0)  -job-input-ad - -schedd-addr <10.14.0.18:52459>

[root@ldas-pcdev1 ~]# pstree -p 22513
condor_starter(22513)───gstlal_inspiral(22521)───sleep(4237)

[root@ldas-pcdev1 ~]# ps -ef | grep 22521
shooper   4237 22521  0 20:52 ?        00:00:00 sleep 3600
root      9220 13151  0 21:07 pts/32   00:00:00 grep 22521
shooper  22521 22513  0 Jul18 ?        00:00:00 /bin/bash /home/shooper/gstlocal/bin/gstlal_inspiral_marginalize_likelihoods_online /mnt/qfs4/shooper/scratch/IIR/ER2/triggers marginalized_likelihood.xml.gz
